alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 1:20PM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected. A light glaze of ice is possible Wednesday afternoon before snowfall begins later in the day. Total snow accumulations of one to three inches and ice accumulations up to a couple hundredths of an inch possible. Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM Wednesday to noon CST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon Wednesday to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could also significantly reduce visibility...possibly below one quarter of a mile at times Wednesday evening and night. These hazardous weather conditions will impact driving. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is high confidence that this will be an exceptionally cold period, especially from late Wednesday night through Saturday. There is a lower confidence in overall snowfall amounts.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
